page.description: Specify if the chart has events. For example, you can call a Javascript function when clicking on a slice of a pie chart, or hovering over a data point on a series.

step.description: On the UX Code page open the Xbasic functions page and add the following.
step.example:
function piedata as c (e as p)
dim explodedSliceNumber as n = -1 if eval_valid("e.__javascriptFunctionResults") then dim data as p = json_parse(e.__javascriptFunctionResults) explodedSliceNumber = convert_type(data.javascriptFunctionResult, "N") end if
if explodedSliceNumber >= 0 then explodedSliceNumber = explodedSliceNumber + 1 end if
dim arr[0] as p arr[].sales = 10 arr[..].region = "East" arr[..].exploded = 0
arr[].sales = 20 arr[..].region = "West" arr[..].exploded = 0
arr[].sales = 15 arr[..].region = "South" arr[..].exploded = 0
arr[].sales = 8 arr[..].region = "North" arr[..].exploded = 0
if explodedSliceNumber > 0 then arr[explodedSliceNumber].exploded = 1 end if
dim txt as c txt = arr.dump_properties("sales|region|exploded")
piedata = txt
end function

step.description: e._javascriptFunctionResults is a value of some javascript that got computed on the client-side befire the callback took place.
Go to the UX Properties page and in the Data Series section click on the Data series property.
In the Data Series Builder select "Custom" as the Data Source Type.
At the bottom of the Data Series Builder find the Custom properties section and set the Xbasic function name property to be "pieData"
Set the Subseries names property to "sales.region.exploded"
Set the Javascript function property to be "pieDataJs".
Go to the UX Code page and click on Javascript functions. Define the following function.
step.note: This function is called when the data series is refreshed. The value returned by this function will be submitted to the server as part of the Ajax callback.
